TopicTitle: orthographic view in build menu and other improvements

Articles.Content:
So, i thought that it would be pretty simple in unity to switch the camera of the build menu to ortographic (or maybe there should be an option to toggle ortographic view). It would make it much easier to adjust parts on the spaceship to have the center of mass at the correct position.

With ortographic view, and with fixed camera rotation button, you could make a visible ruler too (with numbers), or have the item parts's axis lines visible. I think this would be a relatively easy improvement (especially if you dont implement every idea), but it would make it much easier to make stable rockets/airplanes, especially sstos/vtols.

I know its not a 3d modeller program, but i think these things would help a lot in spaceship design. (And for me, half of the gameplay is in the build hangar)
Would also be nice if there was a translate manipulator, and/or the ability to confine the movement via a button press (ie blender).
I bump this. In 3D perspective mode is hard to determine if the centrer of mass is perfectly aligned, a orthographic view (or an option to disable perspective) should be a must.
